ch.aplu.android.bluetooth

Class BluetoothClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.aplu.android.bluetooth.BluetoothClient

  • public class BluetoothClient
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to create a client that connects to a server via Bluetooth. Keep in mind that a server must be up and running before any client can connect.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BluetoothClient(android.bluetooth.BluetoothAdapter adapter, java.lang.String serverAddressHex)
      Creates a BluetoothClient instance for the given server's MAC address.
      BluetoothClient(android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice serverDevice)
      Creates a BluetoothClient instance for the given server's Bluetooth name.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean connect()
      Attemps to connect the client to the server.
      void disconnect()
      Closes the opened input and output stream and releases the Bluetooth connection.
      java.lang.String getAddressHex()
      Returns the server address in colon hex format (NN:NN:NN:NN:NN:NN).
      long getAddressLong()
      Returns the server address as long.
      java.io.InputStream getInputStream()
      Returns the InputStream of the Bluetooth connection.
      java.io.OutputStream getOutputStream()
      Returns the OutputStream of the Bluetooth connection.
      android.bluetooth.BluetoothSocket getSocket()
      Returns the BluetoothSocket of the Bluetooth connection.

      Returns the connection state.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • BluetoothClient

        public BluetoothClient(android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice serverDevice)
        Creates a BluetoothClient instance for the given server's Bluetooth name. No connection is established before connect() is called.
        Parameters:
        serverDevice - the valid BluetoothDevice reference of the server, obtained by a Bluetooth search

      • BluetoothClient

        public BluetoothClient(android.bluetooth.BluetoothAdapter adapter,
               java.lang.String serverAddressHex)
        Creates a BluetoothClient instance for the given server's MAC address. No connection is established before connect() is called.
        Parameters:
        adapter - the BluetoothAdapter for this device
        serverAddressHex - the Bluetooth MAC address of the server in colon hex format (NN:NN:NN:NN:NN:NN)

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public boolean connect()
        Attemps to connect the client to the server. The standard RFCOMM UUID 00001101-0000-1000-8000-00805F9B34FB is used. If the devices are not yet paired (bonded), a pairing dialog is automatically opened. Because the GameGrid's activity onPause() is called, the running application will terminate (unless GameGrid.enableKill(false) is invoked).
        Returns:
        true, if successful; false, if connection cannot be established or already connected

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Closes the opened input and output stream and releases the Bluetooth connection. Any blocking read method of a connected server will return with an end of stream value that informs the server that the client connection is lost. Closing the input stream will cause an IOException thrown by any blocking read method. If you forget to disconnect to release all resources, the next call of connect() may block for ever.

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Returns the connection state.
        Returns:
        true, if connected; otherwise false

      • getSocket

        public android.bluetooth.BluetoothSocket getSocket()
        Returns the BluetoothSocket of the Bluetooth connection.
        Returns:
        the BluetoothSocket or null, if not connected

      • getInputStream

        public java.io.InputStream getInputStream()
        Returns the InputStream of the Bluetooth connection.
        Returns:
        InputStream or null, if not connected

      • getOutputStream

        public java.io.OutputStream getOutputStream()
        Returns the OutputStream of the Bluetooth connection.
        Returns:
        OutputStream or null, if not connected

      • getAddressHex

        public java.lang.String getAddressHex()
        Returns the server address in colon hex format (NN:NN:NN:NN:NN:NN).
        Returns:
        server address in hex format (32 bits), even when the client is not connected to the server

      • getAddressLong

        public long getAddressLong()
        Returns the server address as long.
        Returns:
        server address as 32 bit long, even when the client is not connected to the server
